ticket.title: Implement OAuth2 authentication with Google SSO
ticket.description:
## Overview

We need to implement OAuth2 authentication for our web application using Google as the identity provider.

## Requirements

- Support Google Sign-In button on login page
- Implement PKCE flow for security
- Store refresh tokens securely in the vault
- Add session management with 24h expiry

## Technical Notes

- Use the existing AuthService module
- Follow our security standards for token handling
- Integration with user-service for profile creation
ticket.acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Users can click 'Sign in with Google'
- [ ] First-time users get a profile created
- [ ] Returning users are recognized
- [ ] Sessions expire after 24 hours
- [ ] Refresh tokens work correctly

comments.author: Bob Smith
comments.body:
I reviewed the Google OAuth docs. We should use the authorization code flow with PKCE, not implicit flow. This is more secure for web apps.

See: https://developers.google.com/identity/protocols/oauth2/web-server

comments.author: Carol Davis
comments.body: Reminder: We need to store the client secret in vault, not in config files. I've created a vault path for this: `secret/auth/google-oauth`

comments.author: Alice Chen
comments.body: Started implementation. I'm basing the token handling on the pattern from the payments-auth module. Using jose library for JWT validation.
